source:
at the grand old age of 75 , jack nicklaus is still capable of hitting aces .
the golden bear added another magic moment to his storied career at augusta national in the par-3 contest .
stepping up to the tee on the 130-yard fourth , the greatest golfer of all time saw his shot sail beyond the flag before spinning back into the hole .
jack nicklaus gave the crowd something to cheer with a hole in one on the fourth during the par-3 contest
nicklaus holds up his ball to an adoring crowd as gary player ( left ) and ben crenshaw salute the great
crenshaw and nicklaus fist pump following his ace on the 130-yard hole at augusta national
nicklaus was playing alongside gary player and ben crenshaw as the first roar of masters week filled the skies in a sunswept georgia .
` i had an interview this morning , and i said " well , all i 've got to do is go out and win the par-3 and make a hole and one " , and i make a hole in one , ' nicklaus said afterwards .
the ace was nicklaus ' first on the hallowed turf of augusta , but the veteran saw his achievement eclipsed by that of camilo villegas on a day which saw five hole-in-ones , levelling the record from 2002 .
the colombian followed nicklaus with an ace on the fourth and also managed one on the eighth , but he could n't quite land the title , losing out to world no 74 kevin streelman in a play-off .

nicklaus became the youngest person to wear a green jacket in 1963 , and collected his sixth in 1986 .
he is one of five men to complete the career grand slam , an accolade which favourite rory mcilroy can achieve if he wins his third major in succession .
summary: Jack Nicklaus, aged 75, achieved a hole-in-one on the 130-yard fourth hole during the Par-3 Contest at Augusta National. This was his first hole-in-one on the hallowed turf of Augusta. However, his achievement was eclipsed by Camilo Villegas, who also made two holes-in-one on the same day, one on the fourth and another on the eighth. Despite Villegas's performance, Kevin Streelman won the event in a play-off. Nicklaus is a renowned golfer, having won the Masters Tournament six times, with his first victory coming in 1963 at the age of 22, making him the youngest person to wear a green jacket. He is one of five men to complete the career Grand Slam. Rory McIlroy, a current favorite, can achieve this accolade if he wins his third major in succession.

summary: At 75 years old, Jack Nicklaus continues to impress with his golf skills, including a hole-in-one at the Par-3 contest during Masters Week at Augusta National. Playing alongside Gary Player and Ben Crenshaw, Nicklaus achieved his first hole-in-one on Augusta's hallowed turf, but was later surpassed by Camilo Villegas, who also scored a hole-in-one on the fourth and eighth holes. Nicklaus is one of five men to complete the career grand slam and holds the record for being the youngest person to wear a green jacket in 1963.

summary:
Here's a concise summary of the passage:

Jack Nicklaus, at 75 years old, hit a hole-in-one during the par-3 contest at Augusta National. This occurred on the 130-yard fourth hole while playing alongside Gary Player and Ben Crenshaw. It was Nicklaus' first ace at Augusta. The day saw a total of five hole-in-ones, tying a record from 2002. Camilo Villegas also hit two aces but lost the contest to Kevin Streelman in a playoff. The passage mentions Nicklaus' impressive career, including his six Masters wins and status as one of five men to complete the career grand slam. It also notes that Rory McIlroy could achieve this feat if he wins the upcoming Masters.

This remarkable feat, witnessed by Gary Player and Ben Crenshaw, added to Nicklaus' legendary career. Despite his achievement, Camilo Villegas stole the show by scoring two holes-in-one, tying the record. Nicklaus, the youngest Masters winner in 1963 and a six-time champion, is one of five golfers to achieve the career Grand Slam, a feat Rory McIlroy aims to replicate.

summary: Jack Nicklaus, at 75 years old, hit an ace during the par-3 contest at Augusta National, adding to his legendary golf career. He achieved this on the 130-yard fourth hole, impressing the crowd and fellow players Gary Player and Ben Crenshaw. This was Nicklaus's first hole-in-one at Augusta, though Camilo Villegas matched the feat on the same hole, along with another on the eighth, leading to a play-off where Kevin Streelman won. Nicklaus is known for his achievements, including being the youngest to wear a green jacket in 1963 and winning his sixth major in 1986. He is one of only five men to complete the career grand slam.

summary: Jack Nicklaus, at the age of 75, aced the fourth hole during the par-3 contest at Augusta National. This was his first ace on the course. Five aces were made during the contest, tying the record set in 2002. Camilo Villegas also aced the fourth hole and the eighth hole, but lost the contest to Kevin Streelman in a playoff. Nicklaus won his first Masters in 1963 and his sixth in 1986. He is one of five golfers to complete the career grand slam, which Rory McIlroy can achieve if he wins his third major in a row.

summary: At 75, Jack Nicklaus demonstrated his enduring skill by hitting a hole-in-one during the par-3 contest at Augusta National. On the 130-yard fourth hole, his shot sailed past the flag before spinning back into the hole, thrilling the crowd. Playing alongside Gary Player and Ben Crenshaw, Nicklaus celebrated with a fist pump. This was his first ace at Augusta, though the day saw five hole-in-ones, including two by Camilo Villegas. Nicklaus, who first won a green jacket in 1963 and his sixth in 1986, is one of five men to complete the career grand slam. Rory McIlroy could join this elite group if he wins his third major in succession.
